name: Natural History Museum of Utah
address: 301 Wakara Way, Salt Lake City, UT 84108
description: A museum showcasing Utah’s geology, paleontology (dinosaurs), ecosystems, and cultural history with panoramic views of the Salt Lake Valley.

name: Red Butte Garden & Arboretum
address: 300 Wakara Way, Salt Lake City, UT 84108
description: Utah’s state arboretum with themed botanical gardens, natural trails, and seasonal concerts.

name: Temple Square
address: 50 North Temple Street, Salt Lake City, UT
description: Five downtown city blocks featuring historic buildings, gardens, the Tabernacle, Assembly Hall, and visitor centers related to the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

name: This Is The Place Heritage Park
address: 2601 East Sunnyside Ave, Salt Lake City, UT 84108
description: A 450-acre living history park with pioneer-era buildings, costumed interpreters, train rides, farm animals, and gold-panning.

name: Utah’s Hogle Zoo
address: 2600 East Sunnyside Ave, Salt Lake City, UT 84108
description: A zoo with over 800 animals, interactive exhibits, a splash pad, carousel, and seasonal events.

name: Clark Planetarium
address: 110 S 400 W, Salt Lake City, UT 84101
description: Interactive science and space museum with free exhibits and immersive dome and IMAX shows for an additional fee.

name: Great Salt Lake / Stansbury Island
address: Antelope Island State Park, accessed via Antelope Drive, Syracuse, UT (I-15 Exit 332)
description: A natural getaway to experience the Great Salt Lake: wildlife viewing (bison, antelope), hiking, floating in the lake, and scenic drives.

name: Utah Museum of Fine Arts (UMFA)
address: 410 Campus Center Drive, Salt Lake City, UT 84112

cost.free_days: First Wednesday & third Saturday each month

description: The state’s premier art museum with global collections from ancient to contemporary, plus rotating exhibitions and programs.

name: Neighborhood & Mural Walks
address: Various areas: Downtown, 9th & 9th, The Avenues, Maven District
description: Explore Salt Lake City’s vibrant street art, murals, and local neighborhood culture on foot.

name: Live Shows & Concerts
address: Various venues: Eccles Theater, Capitol Theatre, The Depot, The State Room
description: Salt Lake City’s performing arts scene includes Broadway musicals, concerts, plays, and local entertainment across multiple venues.
